article:
{{Multiple issues
| notability = June 2012|


}}

'Walls' are an electronic band from the UK. Having originated in Manchester they
moved to London in 1996. http://www.kompakt.fm/releases/walls They are
a two piece composed of Sam Willis and Alessio Natalizia, both of whom were
previously in the band Vib Gyor. http://venueone.com/#!/blog/interview-fossil-
collective Willis creates music that is said to combine euphoric pop with
glitchy beats to produce a unique sound. The Cologne influence which he cites as
very important is easily identifiable. Their first album (self titled) picked up
Mojo's Electronic Album Of The Year. They were also featured in NME's end-of-
year list.

Walls won critical acclaim with their second album âCoracleâ on 26 September
2011 â they captured the layers of guitar and synths, harmonic melodies and
driven beats that made their debut an instant cult hit. Their first single
"Sunporch" released on 29 August 2011 is a stunning mix of guitars and
percussions, once again taking the mind away on holiday.

Walls debut was also a favourite amongst their contemporaries â Jamie xx,
Caribou, James Holden and Battles http://www.bbc.co.uk/music/reviews/5wcg http://www.beardedmagazine.com/news/article/walls-release-new-
single The Field and Pantha Du Prince are also known to have collaborated
with the artist. http://norwichartscentre.co.uk/walls/

Walls are signed to Kompakt record label and have featured on a compilation
named Total 11.
